message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze data from the World Values Survey (WVS) and the European Values Study (EVS) to explore the relationship between social trust and political institutions across countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Values Study"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses household survey data from the India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II) to investigate patterns of intergenerational mobility in educational attainment for urban and rural areas.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II)"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We combine firm-level panel data from the Mexican Annual Industrial Survey (MAIS) with information on environmental regulation to estimate the effects of regulatory stringency on firm productivity.", "dataset": ["Mexican Annual Industrial Survey (MAIS)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs cross-sectional data from the Customs Trade Statistics Database (COMTRADE) to examine patterns of international trade in natural rubber.", "dataset": ["Customs Trade Statistics Database (COMTRADE)"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) to assess the impact of food insecurity on child health outcomes in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES)"], "topic": ["Health", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This empirical analysis draws on household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) in Ethiopia to investigate the factors associated with child stunting.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a novel dataset comprising of company-level financial statements and ownership data for Vietnam's largest publicly traded firms.", "dataset": ["company-level financial statements", "ownership data"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using high resolution remote sensing data from the Global Land Analysis and Discovery (GLAD) system, we estimate the extent of forest cover change in Brazil's Amazon region.", "dataset": ["Global Land Analysis and Discovery (GLAD)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We link firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey with secondary industry-level data from the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) to analyze the effects of trade liberalization on firms' export market participation.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines household survey data from the Panel Study of Income Dynamics (PSID) with county-level information on natural disaster occurrence to investigate the determinants of household resilience to natural disasters in the United States.", "dataset": ["Panel Study of Income Dynamics (PSID)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyze data from the World Values Survey (WVS) and the European Values Study (EVS) to explore the relationship between social trust and political institutions across countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Values Study"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses household survey data from the India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II) to investigate patterns of intergenerational mobility in educational attainment for urban and rural areas.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II)"], "topic": comprising of company-level financial statements and ownership data for Vietnam's largest publicly traded firms.", "dataset": ["company-level financial statements", "ownership data"], "topic": industry-level data from the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) to analyze the effects of trade liberalization on firms' export market participation.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines household survey data from the Panel Study of Income Dynamics (PSID) with county-level information on natural disaster occurrence to investigate the determinants of household resilience to natural disasters in the United States.", "dataset": ["Panel Study of Income Dynamics (PSID)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]}]
